details.description:
Please note that the British consulate in Split will be closed 18 June to 01 July 2014. 
If you are a British national in need of urgent consular assistance during this period, please call the embassy telephone number 00 385 1 600 9100.
details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

  • Monday to Thursday, 8:30am to 5pm
  • Friday, 8:30am to 2pm

2014 public holidays

  • Wednesday 1 January
  • Monday 06 January
  • Friday 18 April
  • Monday 21 April
  • Thursday 01 May
  • Friday 23 May or Tuesday 27 May
  • Thursday 19 June
  • Wednesday 25 June
  • Tuesday 05 August
  • Friday 15 August
  • Wednesday 08 October
  • Wednesday 24 December
  • Thursday 25 December
  • Friday 26 December

Getting to the embassy

Our office is located at Ivana Lučića 4, a little more than 100 metres south of Vukovarska Street–the main avenue in the vicinity.

By taxi

Zagreb has taxi stands all over the city and it is not difficult to find a free taxi at any time of day.

By bus

There are no bus services to the embassy.

By tram

There is excellent tram service in Zagreb. The line numbers that service the area of the embassy are 3, 5 and 13. The tram station closest to the embassy is “Sveučilišna aleja”. The price of a one-way ticket is 12 HRK (approx. £1.25) if you purchase the ticket at a kiosk, 15 HRK if you purchase it on the tram.

Parking

In the immediate vicinity, there is plenty of public parking. The embassy is located in the II zone–the cost of parking is 5 HRK (£0.60) per hour.

Security

We do our utmost to ensure a safe and secure environment for your visit. Please co-operate with the security team as they conduct their checks and controls, each of which should take only a few minutes. The security measures in place are for the benefit of all visitors and staff.

Visitors to our office will have to go through the security checkpoint at the entrance. Mobile phones and electronic devices are to be checked in at reception.
